docs.lead_paragraph: As part of our continuing quest to help you win your Oscar pool - and again, not at all as part of an end-of-season notebook dump - the Bagger returns to the hard-to-predict sound design category.

headline.main: Crystal-Clear Conversation Amid the Pounding Music

docs.snippet: A Brazilian star of 'Waste Land' will be allowed into the U.S. in time for the Oscar ceremony, and its director has found something to wear to the big evening....
docs.lead_paragraph: The last time the Bagger encountered Lucy Walker, a director of the Oscar-nominated documentary "Waste Land," she was worried about two things: Whether a star of her film, a Brazilian trash picker named Sebastiao Carlos dos Santos and known as Tiao, would be able to get a visa to get into the United States for the ceremony; and what she would wear to it.
docs.abstract: A Brazilian star of 'Waste Land' will be allowed into the U.S. in time for the Oscar ceremony, and its director has found something to wear to the big evening.

headline.main: Visas, Fancy Dresses and a Garbage-Strewn Documentary

docs.snippet: Michael S. Smith, chosen by the Obamas to redecorate, will be doing the honors for the Architectural Digest green room at the Oscars....
docs.lead_paragraph: What were we saying about the public relations Oscar drip? Oh, right. So this year the Academy Awards green room - sponsored for the ninth consecutive year by Architectural Digest - will be designed by Michael S. Smith, we're now allowed to exclusively announce. Mr. Smith, who was chosen to help redecorate the White House, envisions the nominees and presenters lounging around in his "elegant, 1940s-style library - complete with a sophisticated color palette and furnishings that celebrate Hollywood's golden era," according to a statement from the magazine. Margaret Russell, the editor in chief, added that "though his design reflects midcentury Hollywood glamour, his interpretation of the space is state of the art." Also, the space is officially called the Architectural Digest Oscar Greenroom, which is, we're sure, how everyone will officially refer to it on the night of the show.
docs.abstract: Michael S. Smith, chosen by the Obamas to redecorate, will be doing the honors for the Architectural Digest green room at the Oscars.

headline.main: An Oscar Turn for White House Decorator

docs.snippet: The latest documentary from the Oscar-nominated director Liz Garbus, "Bobby Fischer Against the World," has been bought by Music Box Films....
docs.lead_paragraph: It has been almost 40 years since Bobby Fischer won the world chess championship, and more than three years since he died. Now, thanks to a documentary that made its debut at the Sundance Film Festival last month, audiences who may not know the story of Fischer's brilliant but disturbed life will get a chance to learn about it this summer and fall.
docs.abstract: The latest documentary from the Oscar-nominated director Liz Garbus, "Bobby Fischer Against the World," has been bought by Music Box Films.

headline.main: Music Box Makes Its Bobby Fischer Move

docs.snippet: With the Academy Awards a mere 12 days away, details are beginning to leak out about the telecast - or rather, be meted out in a very methodical, public relations-managed way....
docs.lead_paragraph: With the Academy Awards a mere 12 days away, details are beginning to leak out about the telecast - or rather, be meted out in a very methodical, public relations-managed way. The Oscar producers, Bruce Cohen and Don Mischer, told Entertainment Weekly that the early promos featuring the show's hosts, James Franco and Anne Hathaway, were filmed on the first day they met, capturing their instant chemistry. "They really play very well off of each other," Mr. Cohen told Mandi Bierly. "Anne is like this hilarious Type-A overachiever who will just try anything, and James can just kind of look at her, and it's funny." Both stars are pitching ideas to the writers, who include, as usual, the veteran joke-slinger Bruce Vilanch. (He's already made some cracks about Ernest Borgnine in a "Black Swan" outfit.)
docs.abstract: With the Academy Awards a mere 12 days away, details are beginning to leak out about the telecast - or rather, be meted out in a very methodical, public relations-managed way.

headline.main: Chemistry and Showstoppers at the Oscars Ceremony
